properties.Name: The Royal Palace
properties.description: Unfortunately, I didn't see the royal family when walking past the palace, but it was a good reminder that Norway has a monarch.

properties.Name: Vippa
properties.description: Vippa is a really cool food hall in Oslo! There was a wide range of food and drinks available. I had sweet potato tacos and spinach dumplings as well as a local beer.

properties.Name: BrewDog Grünerløkka
properties.description: While I was in Oslo, there was a street fair in Grunerlokka, a neighborhood with a lot of vintage shops, boutiques, bars, restaurants. I brought only a small carry-on bag with me to Oslo, so I didn't buy anything. I did stop at the BrewDog bar and had the Jet Black Heart coffee stout.

properties.Name: Munch Museum
properties.description: The Munch Museum was definitely a highlight. I saw the painting The Scream. I was not previously familiar with much else Munch had done, but I really enjoyed the rest of his work. He had some incredible, massive paintings that I did not expect. The museum is about to move to a new location, so the curators had some special exhibitions about the history of the museum.

properties.Name: The University's Botanical Garden
properties.description: We walked through the botanical gardens from Grunnerlokka to get to the Munch Museum. There were some cherry blossom trees in bloom!

properties.Name: Oslo Opera House
properties.description: The Oslo Opera House is near the city center on the water, and it is meant to look to look like an iceberg. The architecture allows visitors to walk up to the roof for some nice panoramic views of Oslo's city center. The inside was very nice, too.

properties.Name: Viking Ship Museum
properties.description: The Viking Ship museum was a fun experience. There are three large ships and a lot of small exhibits showcasing what was found in the viking burial mounds where the ships were found.

properties.Name: Aker brygge Ferry Terminal
properties.description: The ferry terminals to the museum are not connected to the rest of the public transportation, and cost about $9 USD for a round trip.

properties.Name: Dronningen Ferry Terminal
properties.description: The Viking Ship museum is a short walk from the Dronnigen ferry stop.

properties.Name: The Tiger
properties.description: A trip to Oslo is not complete without a picture of the Tiger in front of the Central Station. Oslo has a lot of statues and public art, but this is may be one of the most famous and photographed.
